page.title: 06L'ETACQ WOODCRAFTS
page.content:
This woodcraft workshop, which was started over thirty years ago now exports to countries such as Australia, Japan, and America. It is a tourist attraction but has been set up as a commercial venture first. This means that there is no formal demonstration of the work of the craftsmen. You could see a name plate for a local house being carved or a special piece of furniture being made.
Some tourist items are made from the many types of exotic hard woods which are imported from all over the world.
There is also a show room and a cafe on the premises but on a hot summer's day what better than a cool ice cream from the van in the car park?
